reboot.soc_reset.name: soc_reset
reboot.soc_reset.doc:
Writing 0xAC to this register will do a full SoC reset, including CRGs and
peripherals

reboot.addr.name: addr
reboot.addr.doc: The address written here will be used as the next reset vector

reboot.cpu_reset.name: cpu_reset
reboot.cpu_reset.doc:
Writing anything to this register resets the CPU, and the CPU only; does not
affect CRG or peripherals

gpio.output.name: output
gpio.output.doc: Values to appear on GPIO when respective `drive` bit is asserted

gpio.input.name: input
gpio.input.doc: Value measured on the respective GPIO pin

gpio.drive.name: drive
gpio.drive.doc: When a bit is set to `1`, the respective pad drives its value out

gpio.intena.name: intena
gpio.intena.doc: Enable interrupts when a respective bit is set

gpio.intpol.name: intpol
gpio.intpol.doc:
When a bit is `1`, falling-edges cause interrupts. Otherwise, rising edges cause
interrupts.

gpio.uartsel.name: uartsel
gpio.uartsel.doc:
Used to select which UART is routed to physical pins, 00 = kernel debug, 01 =
console, others reserved based on build

gpio.ev_status.name: ev_status
gpio.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the event7 event trigger.
Writes to this register have no effect.

fields.name: event7
fields.doc:
`1` if a this particular event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising**
edge.

fields.name: event6
fields.doc:
`1` if a this particular event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising**
edge.

fields.name: event5
fields.doc:
`1` if a this particular event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising**
edge.

fields.name: event4
fields.doc:
`1` if a this particular event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising**
edge.

fields.name: event3
fields.doc:
`1` if a this particular event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising**
edge.

fields.name: event2
fields.doc:
`1` if a this particular event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising**
edge.

fields.name: event1
fields.doc:
`1` if a this particular event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising**
edge.

fields.name: event0
fields.doc:
`1` if a this particular event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising**
edge.

gpio.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
gpio.ev_pending.doc:
When a  event7 event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this register.
To clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: event7
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``event7`` Event

fields.name: event6
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``event6`` Event

fields.name: event5
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``event5`` Event

fields.name: event4
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``event4`` Event

fields.name: event3
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``event3`` Event

fields.name: event2
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``event2`` Event

fields.name: event1
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``event1`` Event

fields.name: event0
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``event0`` Event

gpio.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
gpio.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding event7 events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

uart.ev_status.name: ev_status
uart.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the rx event trigger.  Writes to
this register have no effect.

fields.name: rx
fields.doc: `1` if a `rx` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling** edge.

fields.name: tx
fields.doc: `1` if a `tx` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling** edge.

uart.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
uart.ev_pending.doc:
When a  rx event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this register.  To
clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: rx
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``rx`` Event

fields.name: tx
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``tx`` Event

uart.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
uart.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding rx events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

console.ev_status.name: ev_status
console.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the rx event trigger.  Writes to
this register have no effect.

fields.name: rx
fields.doc: `1` if a `rx` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling** edge.

fields.name: tx
fields.doc: `1` if a `tx` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling** edge.

console.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
console.ev_pending.doc:
When a  rx event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this register.  To
clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: rx
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``rx`` Event

fields.name: tx
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``tx`` Event

console.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
console.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding rx events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

app_uart.ev_status.name: ev_status
app_uart.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the rx event trigger.  Writes to
this register have no effect.

fields.name: rx
fields.doc: `1` if a `rx` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling** edge.

fields.name: tx
fields.doc: `1` if a `tx` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling** edge.

app_uart.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
app_uart.ev_pending.doc:
When a  rx event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this register.  To
clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: rx
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``rx`` Event

fields.name: tx
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``tx`` Event

app_uart.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
app_uart.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding rx events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

info.git_major.name: git_major
info.git_major.doc:
Major git tag version.  For example, this firmware was built from git tag
``v0.8.0``, so this value is ``0``.

info.git_minor.name: git_minor
info.git_minor.doc:
Minor git tag version.  For example, this firmware was built from git tag
``v0.8.0``, so this value is ``8``.

info.git_revision.name: git_revision
info.git_revision.doc:
Revision git tag version.  For example, this firmware was built from git tag
``v0.8.0``, so this value is ``0``.

info.git_gitrev.name: git_gitrev
info.git_gitrev.doc:
First 32-bits of the git revision.  This documentation was built from git rev
``45bbf751``, so this value is 1169946449, which should be enough to check out
the exact git version used to build this firmware.

info.git_gitextra.name: git_gitextra
info.git_gitextra.doc:
The number of additional commits beyond the git tag.  For example, if this value
is ``1``, then the repository this was built from has one additional commit
beyond the tag indicated in `MAJOR`, `MINOR`, and `REVISION`.

fields.name: dirty
fields.doc:
Set to ``1`` if this device was built from a git repo with uncommitted
modifications.

fields.name: mode
fields.doc: The current configuration mode of the SRAM

fields.name: trigger
fields.doc: Writing to this bit triggers the SRAM mode status read update

fields.name: updateall
fields.doc: Update full screen regardless of tag state

fields.name: updatedirty
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to flush dirty lines to the LCD

memlcd.busy.name: busy
memlcd.busy.doc: A ``1`` indicates that the block is currently updating the LCD

memlcd.prescaler.name: prescaler
memlcd.prescaler.doc:
Prescaler value. LCD clock is module ``(clock / (prescaler+1))``. Reset value:
``99``, so for a default sysclk of 100MHz this yields an LCD ``SCLK`` of 1MHz

memlcd.ev_status.name: ev_status
memlcd.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the done event trigger.  Writes
to this register have no effect.

fields.name: done
fields.doc: `1` if a `done` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling** edge.

memlcd.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
memlcd.ev_pending.doc:
When a  done event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this register.
To clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: done
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``done`` Event

memlcd.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
memlcd.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding done events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

com.tx.name: tx
com.tx.doc: Tx data, for COPI. Note: 32-bit CSRs are required for this block to work!

fields.name: autohold
fields.doc: Disallow transmission start if hold if asserted

fields.name: tip
fields.doc: Set when transaction is in progress

com.ev_status.name: ev_status
com.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the spi_hold event trigger.
Writes to this register have no effect.

fields.name: spi_hold
fields.doc:
`1` if a `spi_hold` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling**
edge.

fields.name: spi_int
fields.doc:
`1` if a `spi_int` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling**
edge.

com.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
com.ev_pending.doc:
When a  spi_hold event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this
register.  To clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: spi_hold
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``spi_hold`` Event

fields.name: spi_int
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``spi_int`` Event

com.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
com.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding spi_hold events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

i2c.prescale.name: prescale
i2c.prescale.doc:
Prescaler value. Set to (module clock / (5 * I2C freq) - 1). Example: if module
clock is equal to sysclk; syclk is 100MHz; and I2C freq is 100kHz, then
prescaler is (100MHz / (5 * 100kHz) - 1) = 199. Reset value: 0xFFFF

fields.name: en
fields.doc: When set to `1`, the core is enabled.

fields.name: ien
fields.doc: When set to `1`, interrupts are enabled.

i2c.txr.name: txr
i2c.txr.doc:
Next byte to transmit to slave devices. LSB indicates R/W during address phases,
`1` for reading from slaves, `0` for writing to slaves

i2c.rxr.name: rxr
i2c.rxr.doc: Data being read from slaved devices

fields.name: ack
fields.doc: when a receiver, sent ack (`ACK=0`) or nack (`ACK=1`)

fields.name: resvd
fields.doc: reserved for cross-compatibility with OpenCores drivers

fields.name: iack
fields.doc: Interrupt acknowledge; when set, clears a pending interrupt

fields.name: rxack
fields.doc: Received acknowledge from slave. 1 = no ack received, 0 = ack received

fields.name: busy
fields.doc: I2C block is busy processing the latest command

fields.name: arblost
fields.doc: Set when arbitration for the bus is lost

fields.name: resvd
fields.doc: reserved for cross-compatibility with OpenCores drivers

fields.name: if
fields.doc:
Interrupt flag, This bit is set when an interrupt is pending, which will cause a
processor interrupt request if the IEN bit is set. The Interrupt Flag is set
upon the completion of one byte of data transfer.

fields.name: reset
fields.doc:
Write `1` for a synchronous reset of the I2C core. Does not reset the prescale
value. This signal is outside of the OpenCores spec.

i2c.ev_status.name: ev_status
i2c.ev_status.doc: Triggered on the falling edge of TIP

fields.name: txrx_done
fields.doc: Triggered on the falling edge of TIP

fields.name: i2c_int
fields.doc:
Triggered when arbitration is lost or transaction done. Requires IACK write to
clear or else it will re-trigger.

i2c.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
i2c.ev_pending.doc: Triggered on the falling edge of TIP

fields.name: txrx_done
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``txrx_done`` Event

fields.name: i2c_int
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``i2c_int`` Event

i2c.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
i2c.ev_enable.doc: Triggered on the falling edge of TIP

btevents.ev_status.name: ev_status
btevents.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the rtc_int event trigger.
Writes to this register have no effect.

fields.name: rtc_int
fields.doc:
`1` if a `rtc_int` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling**
edge.

fields.name: com_int
fields.doc: `1` if a `com_int` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **rising** edge.

btevents.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
btevents.ev_pending.doc:
When a  rtc_int event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this
register.  To clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: rtc_int
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``rtc_int`` Event

fields.name: com_int
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``com_int`` Event

btevents.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
btevents.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding rtc_int events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

messible.in.name: in
messible.in.doc:
Write half of the FIFO to send data out the Messible. Writing to this register
advances the write pointer automatically.

messible.out.name: out
messible.out.doc:
Read half of the FIFO to receive data on the Messible. Reading from this
register advances the read pointer automatically.

fields.name: have
fields.doc: `1` if data can be read from the OUT FIFO.

fields.name: full
fields.doc: `0` if more data can fit into the IN FIFO.

messible2.in.name: in
messible2.in.doc:
Write half of the FIFO to send data out the Messible. Writing to this register
advances the write pointer automatically.

messible2.out.name: out
messible2.out.doc:
Read half of the FIFO to receive data on the Messible. Reading from this
register advances the read pointer automatically.

fields.name: have
fields.doc: `1` if data can be read from the OUT FIFO.

fields.name: full
fields.doc: `0` if more data can fit into the IN FIFO.

fields.name: reset
fields.doc:
Write a `1` to this bit to reset the count to 0. This bit has priority over all
other requests.

ticktimer.time1.name: time1
ticktimer.time1.doc: Bits 32-63 of `TICKTIMER_TIME`. Elapsed time in systicks

ticktimer.msleep_target1.name: msleep_target1
ticktimer.msleep_target1.doc: Bits 32-63 of `TICKTIMER_MSLEEP_TARGET`. Target time in 1.0ms ticks

ticktimer.ev_status.name: ev_status
ticktimer.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the alarm event trigger.  Writes
to this register have no effect.

fields.name: alarm
fields.doc:
`1` if a `alarm` event occurred. This Event is **level triggered** when the
signal is **high**.

ticktimer.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
ticktimer.ev_pending.doc:
When a  alarm event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this register.
To clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: alarm
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``alarm`` Event

ticktimer.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
ticktimer.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding alarm events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

fields.name: load
fields.doc:
If paused, write a `1` to this bit to load a resume value to the timer. If not
paused, this bit is ignored.

fields.name: pause
fields.doc:
Write a `1` to this field to request a pause to counting, 0 for free-run. Count
pauses on the next tick quanta.

susres.resume_time1.name: resume_time1
susres.resume_time1.doc:
Bits 32-63 of `SUSRES_RESUME_TIME`. Elapsed time to load. Loaded upon writing
`1` to the load bit in the control register. This will immediately affect the
msleep extension.

susres.time1.name: time1
susres.time1.doc:
Bits 32-63 of `SUSRES_TIME`. Cycle-accurate mirror copy of time in systicks,
from the TickTimer

fields.name: paused
fields.doc: When set, indicates that the counter has been paused

fields.name: was_forced
fields.doc:
Used by the bootloader to indicate to the kernel if the current resume was from
a forced suspend (e.g. a timeout happened and a server may be unclean.

fields.name: resume
fields.doc:
Used to transfer the resume state information from the loader to Xous. If set,
indicates we are on the resume half of a suspend/resume.

fields.name: powerdown
fields.doc: Write a `1` to force an immediate powerdown. Use with care.

fields.name: interrupt
fields.doc:
Writing this causes an interrupt to fire. Used by Xous to initiate
suspend/resume from an interrupt context.

susres.ev_status.name: ev_status
susres.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the soft_int event trigger.
Writes to this register have no effect.

fields.name: soft_int
fields.doc:
`1` if a `soft_int` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling**
edge.

susres.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
susres.ev_pending.doc:
When a  soft_int event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this
register.  To clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: soft_int
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``soft_int`` Event

susres.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
susres.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding soft_int events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

fields.name: selfdestruct
fields.doc:
Set this bit to clear BBRAM AES key (if used) and cut power in an annoying-to-
reset fashion

fields.name: boostmode
fields.doc:
Writing a `1` causes the USB port to source 5V. To be active only when playing
the host role.

fields.name: up5k_on
fields.doc: Writing a `1` pulses the UP5K domain to turn on

fields.name: reset_ec
fields.doc: Writing a `1` forces EC into reset. Requires write of `0` to release reset.

fields.name: state
fields.doc:
Current SoC power state. 0x=off or not ready, 10=on and safe to shutdown, 11=on
and not safe to shut down, resets to 01 to allow extSRAM access immediately
during init

fields.name: ec_snoop
fields.doc:
Writing `1` allows the insecure EC to snoop a couple keyboard pads for wakeup
key sequence recognition

fields.name: self
fields.doc: Writing `1` forces self power-on (overrides the EC's ability to power me down)

fields.name: audio
fields.doc: Write `1` to power on the audio subsystem

fields.name: usb_attach
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``usb_attach`` Event

fields.name: q
fields.doc: Readback of current delay amount, useful if inc/ce is used to set

fields.name: lock_reads
fields.doc: When set, locks out read operations (recommended when doing programming)

fields.name: dummy_cycles
fields.doc: Number of dummy cycles for manual command; 0 implies a write, >0 implies read

fields.name: has_arg
fields.doc: When set, transmits the value of `cmd_arg` as the argument to the command

fields.name: cmd_code
fields.doc: Manual command code (first 8 bits, e.g. PP4B is 0x12)

fields.name: exec_cmd
fields.doc: Writing a `1` executes a manual command

spinor.command.name: command
spinor.command.doc:
Write individual bits to issue special commands to SPI; setting multiple bits at
once leads to undefined behavior.

fields.name: cmd_rbk_data
fields.doc: Data read back from a cmd_code that has `write_code` set to 0

fields.name: wdata
fields.doc:
16-bit wide write data presented to FLASH, committed to a 128-entry deep FIFO.
Writes to this register are not cached; note that writes to the SPINOR address
space are also committed to the FIFO, but this space is cached by the CPU, and
therefore not guaranteed to be coherent or in order. The direct wishbone-write
address space is provisioned for e.g. USB bus masters that don't have caching.

spinor.wdata.name: wdata
spinor.wdata.doc: Page data to write to FLASH

spinor.ev_status.name: ev_status
spinor.ev_status.doc:
An ECC event has happened on the current block; triggered by falling edge of
ECC_N

fields.name: ecc_error
fields.doc:
An ECC event has happened on the current block; triggered by falling edge of
ECC_N

spinor.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
spinor.ev_pending.doc:
An ECC event has happened on the current block; triggered by falling edge of
ECC_N

fields.name: ecc_error
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``ecc_error`` Event

spinor.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
spinor.ev_enable.doc:
An ECC event has happened on the current block; triggered by falling edge of
ECC_N

fields.name: ecc_address
fields.doc: Address of the most recent ECC event

fields.name: ecc_overflow
fields.doc:
More than one ECS_N event has happened since th last time ecc_address was
checked

fields.name: ecc_error
fields.doc: Live status of the ECS_N bit (ECC error on current packet when low)

keyboard.row0dat.name: row0dat
keyboard.row0dat.doc: Column data for the given row

keyboard.row1dat.name: row1dat
keyboard.row1dat.doc: Column data for the given row

keyboard.row2dat.name: row2dat
keyboard.row2dat.doc: Column data for the given row

keyboard.row3dat.name: row3dat
keyboard.row3dat.doc: Column data for the given row

keyboard.row4dat.name: row4dat
keyboard.row4dat.doc: Column data for the given row

keyboard.row5dat.name: row5dat
keyboard.row5dat.doc: Column data for the given row

keyboard.row6dat.name: row6dat
keyboard.row6dat.doc: Column data for the given row

keyboard.row7dat.name: row7dat
keyboard.row7dat.doc: Column data for the given row

keyboard.row8dat.name: row8dat
keyboard.row8dat.doc: Column data for the given row

fields.name: keypressed
fields.doc: Triggered every time there is a difference in the row state

fields.name: inject
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``inject`` Event

fields.name: keypressed
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``keypressed`` Event

keyboard.rowchange.name: rowchange
keyboard.rowchange.doc:
The rows that changed at the point of interrupt generation. Does not update
again until the interrupt is serviced.

fields.name: disable
fields.doc: writing a 1 permanently disables the block, until the next cold boot

fields.name: char
fields.doc:
character value to inject. Automatically raises an interrupt upon write. There
is no interlock or FIFO buffering on this, so you can lose characters if you
inject too fast.

seed.seed1.name: seed1
seed.seed1.doc: Bits 32-63 of `SEED_SEED`. Seed used for the build

audio.ev_status.name: ev_status
audio.ev_status.doc: Indicates a Tx error has happened (over/underflow

fields.name: tx_error
fields.doc: Indicates a Tx error has happened (over/underflow

fields.name: tx_ready
fields.doc: Indicates enough space available for next Tx quanta of 256 words

fields.name: rx_error
fields.doc: Indicates an Rx error has happened (over/underflow)

fields.name: rx_ready
fields.doc: Indicates FIFO is ready to read

audio.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
audio.ev_pending.doc: Indicates a Tx error has happened (over/underflow

fields.name: tx_error
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``tx_error`` Event

fields.name: tx_ready
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``tx_ready`` Event

fields.name: rx_error
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``rx_error`` Event

fields.name: rx_ready
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``rx_ready`` Event

audio.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
audio.ev_enable.doc: Indicates a Tx error has happened (over/underflow

fields.name: reset
fields.doc: Writing `1` resets the FIFO. Reset happens regardless of enable state.

fields.name: concatenate_channels
fields.doc: Receive and send both channels atomically

fields.name: empty
fields.doc: No data available in FIFO to read

fields.name: dataready
fields.doc: 256 words of data loaded and ready to read

fields.name: format
fields.doc:
I2S sample format. I2S_FORMAT.I2S_LEFT_JUSTIFIED is left-justified,
I2S_FORMAT.I2S_STANDARD is I2S standard

fields.name: reset
fields.doc: Writing `1` resets the FIFO. Reset happens regardless of enable state.

fields.name: concatenate_channels
fields.doc: Receive and send both channels atomically

fields.name: free
fields.doc: At least 256 words of space free

fields.name: format
fields.doc:
I2S sample format. I2S_FORMAT.I2S_LEFT_JUSTIFIED is left-justified,
I2S_FORMAT.I2S_STANDARD is I2S standard

fields.name: avail
fields.doc: Indicates that the read FIFO is not empty

fields.name: ready
fields.doc: When set, indicates that the TRNG interface is capable of generating numbers

fields.name: data
fields.doc: Latest random data from the FIFO; only valid if ``avail`` bit is set

trng_kernel.ev_status.name: ev_status
trng_kernel.ev_status.doc: Triggered whenever an underrun condition first occurs on the kernel interface

fields.name: error
fields.doc: Triggered whenever an underrun condition first occurs on the kernel interface

fields.name: avail
fields.doc: Triggered anytime there is data available on the kernel interface

trng_kernel.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
trng_kernel.ev_pending.doc: Triggered whenever an underrun condition first occurs on the kernel interface

fields.name: error
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``error`` Event

fields.name: avail
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``avail`` Event

trng_kernel.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
trng_kernel.ev_enable.doc: Triggered whenever an underrun condition first occurs on the kernel interface

fields.name: clr_err
fields.doc: Write ``1`` to this bit to clear the ``errors`` register

fields.name: no_check
fields.doc: When set, disables on-line health checking (for power saving)

fields.name: powersave
fields.doc:
When set, TRNGs are automatically turned off until the low water mark is hit;
when cleared, TRNGs are always on

fields.name: av_dis
fields.doc: When set, disables the avalanche generator as an entropy source

fields.name: ro_dis
fields.doc: When set, disables the ring oscillator as an entropy source

fields.name: enable
fields.doc: Power on the management interface and auto-fill random numbers

fields.name: data
fields.doc: Latest random data from the FIFO; only valid if available bit is set

fields.name: full
fields.doc: Both kernel and server FIFOs have been topped off

fields.name: test
fields.doc:
When set, puts the generator into test mode -- full-size, raw ADC samples are
directly placed into the FIFO at full rate, creating a 'virtual oscilloscope'
snapshot of the avalanche generator waveform.

fields.name: samples
fields.doc:
Number of samples to fold into a single result. Smaller values increase rate but
decrease quality. Default is 32.

fields.name: powerdelay
fields.doc: Delay in microseconds for avalanche generator to stabilize

fields.name: oversampling
fields.doc:
Number of stages to oversample entropy. Normally, each bit is just sampled and
shifted once (so 32 times for 32-bit word). Each increment of oversampling will
add another stage.

fields.name: fuzz
fields.doc:
Modulate the `delay`/`dwell` parameter slightly from run-to-run,  based on
previous run's random values. May help to break ring oscillator resonances
trained by the delay/dwell periodicity.

fields.name: delay
fields.doc:
Sampler delay time. Sets the delay between when the small rings are merged
together, and when the final entropy result is sampled. Value encodes number of
sysclk edges to pass during the delay period. Delay should be long enough for
the signal to propagate around the merged ring, but longer times also means more
coupling of the deterministic sysclk noise into the rings.

fields.name: dwell
fields.doc:
Prescaler to set dwell-time of entropy collection.  Controls the period of how
long the oscillators are in a metastable state to collect entropy  before
sampling. Value encodes the number of sysclk edges to pass during the dwell
period.

fields.name: gang
fields.doc: Fold in collective gang entropy during dwell time

fields.name: av_health
fields.doc: When `1`, Avalanche generator has failed an on-line health test

fields.name: ro_health
fields.doc: When `1`, Ring oscillator has failed an on-line health test

fields.name: kernel_underrun
fields.doc:
If non-zero, a kernel underrun has occurred. Will count number of underruns up
to max field size

fields.name: server_underrun
fields.doc:
If non-zero, a server underrun has occurred. Will count number of underruns up
to max field size

trng_server.ev_status.name: ev_status
trng_server.ev_status.doc: Triggered whenever a health event first occurs

fields.name: health
fields.doc: Triggered whenever a health event first occurs

fields.name: error
fields.doc: Triggered whenever an error condition first occurs on the server interface

fields.name: avail
fields.doc: Triggered anytime there is data available on the server interface

trng_server.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
trng_server.ev_pending.doc: Triggered whenever a health event first occurs

fields.name: health
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``health`` Event

fields.name: error
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``error`` Event

fields.name: avail
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``avail`` Event

trng_server.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
trng_server.ev_enable.doc: Triggered whenever a health event first occurs

trng.xadc_temperature.name: xadc_temperature
trng.xadc_temperature.doc:
Raw Temperature value from XADC.

Temperature (C) = ``Value`` x 503.975 / 4096 - 273.15.

trng.xadc_vccint.name: xadc_vccint
trng.xadc_vccint.doc:
Raw VCCINT value from XADC.

VCCINT (V) = ``Value`` x 3 / 4096.

trng.xadc_vccaux.name: xadc_vccaux
trng.xadc_vccaux.doc:
Raw VCCAUX value from XADC.

VCCAUX (V) = ``Value`` x 3 / 4096.

trng.xadc_vccbram.name: xadc_vccbram
trng.xadc_vccbram.doc:
Raw VCCBRAM value from XADC.

VCCBRAM (V) = ``Value`` x 3 / 4096.

trng.xadc_eoc.name: xadc_eoc
trng.xadc_eoc.doc: End of Convertion Status, ``1``: Convertion Done.

trng.xadc_eos.name: xadc_eos
trng.xadc_eos.doc: End of Sequence Status, ``1``: Sequence Done.

fields.name: select_256
fields.doc: Select SHA512/256 IV constants when set to `1`

fields.name: digest_swap
fields.doc: Swap the endianness on the output digest

fields.name: endian_swap
fields.doc: Swap the endianness on the input data

sha512.config.name: config
sha512.config.doc: Configuration register for the HMAC block

fields.name: hash_process
fields.doc: Writing a 1 digests the hash data

fields.name: hash_start
fields.doc: Writing a 1 indicates the beginning of hash data

sha512.command.name: command
sha512.command.doc: Command register for the HMAC block

sha512.msg_length1.name: msg_length1
sha512.msg_length1.doc:
Bits 32-63 of `SHA512_MSG_LENGTH`. Bottom 64 bits of length of digested message,
in bits

fields.name: sha512_done
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``sha512_done`` Event

fields.name: fifo_full
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``fifo_full`` Event

fields.name: err_valid
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``err_valid`` Event

fields.name: running
fields.doc: hash engine is running and controls are locked out

fields.name: window
fields.doc: Selects the current register window to use

fields.name: mplen
fields.doc:
Length of the current microcode program. Thus valid code must be in the range of
[mpstart, mpstart + mplen]

fields.name: go
fields.doc:
Writing to this puts the engine in `run` mode, and it will execute mplen
microcode instructions starting at mpstart

fields.name: mpc
fields.doc: Current location of the microcode program counter. Mostly for debug.

fields.name: running
fields.doc:
When set, the microcode engine is running. All wishbone access to RF and
microcode memory areas will stall until this bit is clear

fields.name: illegal_opcode
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``illegal_opcode`` Event

fields.name: finished
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``finished`` Event

fields.name: immediate
fields.doc: Used by jumps to load the next PC value

fields.name: cb
fields.doc: set to substitute constant table value for B

fields.name: ca
fields.doc: set to substitute constant table value for A

engine.instruction.name: instruction
engine.instruction.doc:
Current instruction being executed by the engine. The format of this register
exactly reflects the binary layout of an Engine instruction.

jtag.next.name: next
jtag.next.doc: Next state for TDI/TMS; writing automatically clocks TCK

fields.name: ready
fields.doc: JTAG machine is ready for a new cycle; also indicates TDO is valid

fields.name: enable
fields.doc:
Enable the watchdog timer. Cannot be disabled once enabled, except with a reset.
Notably, a watchdog reset will disable the watchdog.

fields.name: reset_code
fields.doc:
Write `600d` then `c0de` in sequence to this register to reset the watchdog
timer

fields.name: period
fields.doc:
Number of 'approximately 65MHz' CFGMCLK cycles before each reset_code must be
entered. Defaults to a range of 1.67-5.00 seconds

fields.name: interrupt
fields.doc:
Writing this causes an interrupt to fire. Used by the kernel to initiate a
routine to reset the WDT in an interrupt context.

wdt.ev_status.name: ev_status
wdt.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the soft_int event trigger.
Writes to this register have no effect.

fields.name: soft_int
fields.doc:
`1` if a `soft_int` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling**
edge.

wdt.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
wdt.ev_pending.doc:
When a  soft_int event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this
register.  To clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: soft_int
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``soft_int`` Event

wdt.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
wdt.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding soft_int events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.

fields.name: count
fields.doc: Number of 1/32768 second ticks before creating a heart beat

fields.name: beat
fields.doc: Set to `1` at the next `count` interval rollover since `clear` was set.

timer0.load.name: load
timer0.load.doc:
Load value when Timer is (re-)enabled. In One-Shot mode, the value written to
this register specifies the Timer's duration in clock cycles.

timer0.reload.name: reload
timer0.reload.doc:
Reload value when Timer reaches ``0``. In Periodic mode, the value written to
this register specify the Timer's period in clock cycles.

timer0.en.name: en
timer0.en.doc:
Enable flag of the Timer. Set this flag to ``1`` to enable/start the Timer.  Set
to ``0`` to disable the Timer.

timer0.update_value.name: update_value
timer0.update_value.doc:
Update trigger for the current countdown value. A write to this register latches
the current countdown value to ``value`` register.

timer0.value.name: value
timer0.value.doc: Latched countdown value. This value is updated by writing to ``update_value``.

timer0.ev_status.name: ev_status
timer0.ev_status.doc:
This register contains the current raw level of the zero event trigger.  Writes
to this register have no effect.

fields.name: zero
fields.doc: `1` if a `zero` event occurred. This Event is triggered on a **falling** edge.

timer0.ev_pending.name: ev_pending
timer0.ev_pending.doc:
When a  zero event occurs, the corresponding bit will be set in this register.
To clear the Event, set the corresponding bit in this register.

fields.name: zero
fields.doc: Write a ``1`` to enable the ``zero`` Event

timer0.ev_enable.name: ev_enable
timer0.ev_enable.doc:
This register enables the corresponding zero events.  Write a ``0`` to this
register to disable individual events.
